# Question

Write a function `wrap_string`. It iterates over words and it will add a new line each time a maximum `text_width::Int=10` would be exceeded. Provide an example

Here's the solution:
```julia
function wrap_string(text::String, text_width::Int=10)
    words = split(text, " ")
    wrapped_words = []
    current_line = ""
    for word in words
        if length(current_line) + length(word) > text_width
            push!(wrapped_words, current_line)
            current_line = word
        else
            current_line *= " " * word
        end
    end
    push!(wrapped_words, current_line)
    return wrapped_words
end
```
Here's an example:
```julia
text = "Lorem ipsum dolor sit amet, consectetur adipiscing elit."
println(wrap_string(text))
# Output: ["Lorem", "ipsum", "dolor", "sit", "amet,", "consectetur", "adipiscing", "elit."]
```
